He gazes at a tattered atlas of whales, its pages scattered with faded sketches of Husa and Mealy Mouth porpoises. A flickering oil lamp casts deep shadows across the cramped study, walls lined with brass sextants and weathered logbooks. The air is heavy with salt‑mold and regret; the narrator’s voice echoes: “God keep me from ever completing anything,” as if the unfinished parchment were a cursed relic. Dark, moody 19th‑century oil painting.

segment_text: This whole book is but a draft, nay, but the draft of a draft.
image_prompt: A dim, storm‑laden study in a 19th‑century oil painting style: an old oak desk piled with rough parchment and half‑finished drafts, a single flickering candle casting wavering shadows; ink stains and feather quill lie beside a cracked sea‑tide map. Through a grimy window, a bleak ocean roils under thunderclouds, hinting at the unfinished voyage. The scene feels mournful, echoing “this whole book is but a draft, nay, but the draft of a draft.”

segment_text: All time, strength, cash and patience.
image_prompt: A dim harbor at twilight, a weathered whaling ship’s deck littered with oil barrels and rusting gear, Captain Ahab stands in the foreground, his face etched with exhaustion yet resolute, clutching a ledger of "time, strength, cash, patience." Around him, crew members—Ishmael, Queequeg, Starbuck—look on with weary determination. The sea churns beneath, waves reflecting a muted moon. The scene is rendered in a dark, moody 19th‑century oil painting style, emphasizing shadow and textured brushwork.
